page.title: 04ST PETER'S CHURCH,DALWOOD.
page.content: The parish church in Dalwood is about 600 years old. The walls are built of flint and the pillars are made from Beer stone. The roof is slate.Dalwood has shared a vicar with Stockland, the next parish, for many years.The present vicar, Rev. Hope, has been vicar for eight years.The church holds 135 seated comfortably. For special services extra seating is brought in.There are six church bells, two of which are medieval. The tower is approx. 65' high. The church clock is run by electricity.On average there are one or two baptisms and marriages per year but around seven to eight burials as the population of Dalwood is mainly elderly people. The newest part of the church is the Children's Corner. The School takes part in special services at Harvest and Christmas.
